item.description:
This was a great, poignant movie that I saw at the Palm Springs International Film Festival (PSIFF). This summer will be filled with films from there. This was an audience favorite at the PSIFF. I'll be there about 7:10 pm.

An aging janitor, who is mistaken for a pilot by a group of children, begins to weave fantasistical stories. Through these imaginary tales, he is able to transport the children away from their grim neighborhood.
item.how_to_find_us: I still look like my picture, pony tail, glasses.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Captain Abu Raed
